column1: ## noun : declension : paradigm / eg / subtype / irregular
## adj = a: declension (1, 2, 3, 1&2) : paradigm / eg / subtype / irregular
*First and second declension -r adjectives without contractions
*First and second declension -r adjectives with contractions
*<altissimus, altissima, altissimum> - highest, deepest (superlative of altus)
&a:comp&sup:e=idoneus solitarius ebrius meritorious gramineus bellatorius arduus
&a:comp&sup:i=bonus malus parvus multus propinquus maturus nequam posterus postumus superus summus exterus extimus inferus imus senex iuvenis iunior
*[i] <plūs>: Noun used with genitive to express more of something in the singular; in the plural used as an adjective: <plūrēs, plūra>, genitive <plūrium>.
*[ii] <mātūrrimus>: Often replaced by the regular form <mātūrissimus, mātūrissima, mātūrissimum>.
*[iv] <minimus nātū>: Sometimes <iunissimus> is found in medieval Latin, e.g. Callistus Nicephorus, Ecclesiastica Historia, 1574.
